column4: How can I tell exactly what hard drive/partition that Grub is installed on?
is this a dual boot?
it uses the same MBR as windows
which version of grub?
hmm sorry I don't know which ver is with jaunty...maybe someone else can step in.
this may help: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/GrubHowto
samba4 isn't part of ubuntu..yet, you may want to ask in #samba
you may want to ask in #clamav
from what I can glean on your error it may be related to gnome-themes.  Try removing any themes you're using.

I didn't say for sure ;)  I looked your error and there is a bug one user states: Regarding the evolution issue, deleting ~/.gconfd/saved_state and (if it exists) ~/.gconfd/saved_state.tmp may fix the problem. You can also try with a new user and see if it happens too. If it doesn't then it's a problem with your user's profile. If you can reproduce this error with a new profile then don't hesitate to submit a new report.
good luck, follow up if it continues.
have you tried gmusicbrowser?
no, but I'd REALLY like to stick with rhythmbox since it does a nice job of playlist handling with my Sansa...
I just hate how right now, it picked up 461 songs when there's almost 1200 on here.
OK, Can't say I've had any luck with rythmbox  personally.
Gmusicbrowser handles my gvfs library without concern.
I'm trying it now, but I'm still very curious about rhythmbox.
I personally gave up on rythmbox
I would.
I refuse.
good luck with that.
gmusicbrowser is the only player that manages my library, rythmbox is crap.
agreed.
